name: VLSCI Pipelines
body:
## Goals of the VLSCI GitHub
* To collect together pipelines for bioinformatics (and misc. software tools)
* To promote collaboration and keeping pipelines up to date.

More generic and user-friendly pipelines will be starred so that they rise to the top.

## Pipelines

### [exome_variant_calling_pipeline-bpipe](https://github.com/vlsci/exome_variant_calling_pipeline-bpipe)
Pipeline tool: Bpipe

Description: An exome variant calling pipeline using BWA mem and GATK

### [bpipe-qiime_closed_otus](https://github.com/vlsci/bpipe-qiime_closed_otus)
Pipeline tool: Bpipe

Description: A pipeline to assign otu's for 16S reads from fastq files

### [bpipe-trinotate](https://github.com/vlsci/bpipe-trinotate)
Pipeline tool: Bpipe

Description: A script to run the Trinotate transcriptome annotation pipeline

## Guidelines for contributing

### New pipelines
* To contribute a pipeline, create a new repository and add your code. 
* The name of your repository should include the framework (generally the pipeline tool) and the purpose of the pipeline.
* We recommend a BSD3 licence, however the choice is up to the creator.
* The person who first submits the pipeline up takes responsibility for it. For example by responding to pull requests.

### Changes to existing pipelines
If you would like to contribute to an existing pipeline, fork it, make your changes and then and submit a pull request.

### Authors and Contributors
* Harriet Dashnow @hdashnow
* Clare Sloggett @claresloggett
* Juan Nunez-Iglesias @jni
* Simon Gladman @Slugger70

* Charlotte Anderson @canderson1
